comments:
I had this problem with the build from 
ftp://wswbanon@ott4f.ott.oti.com/teams/WSWB/anon/out/3.0.0/wswb-3.
0M7-200402191300 

I was just trying do some work with Java (e.g. "find references" to a method 
name, and nothing was showing up. It actually seemed to be finding them, but not 
displaying them. I had this stack trace in console and seemed the "root" cause 
was CDT. I suggest, once you confirm/diagnose this problem that you "pass it 
along" to some other team (not sure who) since a NPE in your code shouldn't 
break other's ... you know, when I wasn't even really using CDT. 
Thanks.

David,

I tried the build with a simple java project and I can find Java references 
with no problems.  Is it possible to give more details like the project you 
have used and/or more steps?

Thanks in advance.

Andrew(the king search),
  I will leave it in your hands.  It looks like they may not
be any IMarker with the attribute you want.

Reassigning.

I've not been able tor reproduce today. I "restored" my environment to include 
the cdt plugins, again, and now tried the same thing, and all seems to work 
fine. So ... I'm changing the severity to 'normal', just to keep track that 
some mysterious things are going on (probably unrelated to cdt) but obviously 
not a 'blocker' if it is hard to reproduce.

For some reason it looks like org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.search.PathNameSorter 
is being used to sort the Java search result instead of 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.search.PathNameSorter.

Why this would happen, I don't know, I'll have to dig around more.  But CDT's 
sorter is assuming that its sorting the results of a CDT search.

I can fix the NPE, but without knowing why the java sorter wasn't used, its not 
a complete fix.

Created an attachment (id=8061)
plugin.xml for org.eclipse.cdt.ui

The JDT and CDT used the same ids for the sorter extensions.  This probably 
caused the CDT's sorter to be used for JDT's search.

I have changed CDT's ids to org.eclipse.cdt.*
I have also checked for null pointers in the CDT sorter just in case.

find attached a new plugin.xml to replace org.eclipse.cdt.ui's plugin.xml to 
test the id changes without waiting for the next build.
